official-title.#text:
To authorize funds to prevent housing discrimination
		  through the use of nationwide testing, to increase funds for the Fair Housing
		  Initiatives Program, and for other purposes.

header.#text:
Grants to private
			 entities to study housing discrimination

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 carry out a competitive matching grant program to assist public and private
			 nonprofit organizations in—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

text.#text:
the causes of
			 housing discrimination and segregation;

the effects of
			 housing discrimination and segregation on education, poverty, and economic
			 development; or

implementing pilot
			 projects that test solutions that will help prevent or alleviate housing
			 discrimination and segregation.

To
			 be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a public or private
			 nonprofit organization shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

text.#text:
agree to provide
			 matching non-Federal funds for 50 percent of the total amount of the grant,
			 which matching funds may include items donated on an in-kind contribution
			 basis; and

meet the requirements of a qualified fair
			 housing enforcement organization, as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or
			 subcontract with a qualified fair housing enforcement organization as a primary
			 subcontractor.
